section.title: Absence Proofs
section.t: An absence proof demonstrates that no valid evidence chain exists for a claimed authorship period, supporting the detection of fabricated provenance claims.

section.title: Proof Types
section.t: Three types of absence proofs are defined:

list.t: Demonstrates that the T_difficulty parameter of the VDF proof would require more computation time than was available in the claimed authorship window.
Relies on a trusted monitoring service that can attest to the absence of evidence submission during a claimed period.
Uses environmental signals (device sensors, network telemetry) to demonstrate that the claimed authorship context was not present.
